content:
I've noticed a funny behaviour on different version of documentation for this library
https://docs.rs/quote/1.0.10/quote/macro.quote.html#procedural-macro
https://docs.rs/quote/1.0.11/quote/macro.quote.html#procedural-macro

in version 1.0.11 of the library documentation, text is cut to about 60/70 columns
after scratching my head for awhile I figured that the culprit is the flag to "don't use websites fonts, but system fonts" (or the equivalent in English)
Happens with Firefox 97.0b9 on Linux (on FF 96.0.3 or Edge 97.0.1072.76 on Windows can't reproduce)
probably not worth opening a bug but perhaps just throwing it here for FIY

thanks for reporting! I suspect this is related to https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/93120. The issue we found there was that some items were overflowing the top bar, causing early wrapping down below. That seems to be the case in your demo as well.
thanks for quick sniping the related issue, I wasn't sure what to search for in the issue tracker :)
